conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: extruded walls with thickness, visible floor plane, angled/isometric view, and roof/ceiling removed to expose interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable wall height/thickness and clean corner geometry. Cutaway is consistent and interior is clearly visible; minor simplification/cleanliness issues around some openings/edges.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches the 2D plan well (kitchen/dining left, living center, hall spine, bedrooms right, bath/closets central/bottom). Minor discrepancies: a room label/identity appears incorrect (right room labeled 'Bathroom 2' where plan shows Bedroom 2), and some proportional differences (e.g., living room area text differs). Doors/windows largely align but not all openings can be perfectly confirmed from this view.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures are present (dining table, sofa, beds, bathroom tub/toilet, kitchen counters/appliances). Placement is mostly consistent with room functions; scale/orientation is plausible though simplified.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is clean and readable with good lighting and contrast. However, prominent text labels inside the 3D render reduce presentation cleanliness and can distract from architectural verification.

detected_errors.description: Minor proportional/area-text inconsistencies between plan and 3D (e.g., living room square footage differs), suggesting slight scaling drift.
Room identity/label mismatch: the right-side room is labeled as an additional bathroom ('Bathroom 2') while the 2D plan indicates this space is Bedroom 2.
Text labels embedded in the 3D render reduce presentation cleanliness per rubric.

summary: A clear and true 3D cutaway conversion with strong layout fidelity, with minor proportional drift and a notable room-label/identity mismatch.
